2010.question: Which one of the following is an INCORRECT statement?
options: Siderite is an iron ore of carbonate composition
Hematite is an iron ore with ferro-magnetic character
Limonite is a hydrated iron ore
Magnetite is an iron ore that crystallizes in an isometric system
2010.answer: Hematite is an iron ore with ferro-magnetic character

A pyrite-chalcopyrite-bearing copper ore body has undergone supergene enrichment. Choose the correct statement(s). (Multiple Select Question)
options: Limonite is present in the gossan zone
Cuprite is present in the zone of oxidation
Chalcocite is present in the zone of supergene enrichment
Malachite is present in the primary zone
answer: Limonite is present in the gossan zone
Cuprite is present in the zone of oxidation
Chalcocite is present in the zone of supergene enrichment

Iron ore is mined in Noamundi, Odisha
The largest copper mine in India is located in Malanjkhand, Madhya Pradesh

answer: Rajpura-Dariba in Rajasthan is a working Pb-Zn deposit

Manganese deposit is found in the Mansar Formation, Maharashtra

Choose the correct statement(s): (Multiple Select Question)
options: Stratiform chromite deposits form by weathering of ultramafic rocks.
Skarn deposits mostly form in calcareous host rocks in contact with felsic intrusives.
Nickeliferous laterite is a type of placer deposit.
Gold-bearing vein deposits can form from hydrothermal solutions.
answer: Skarn deposits mostly form in calcareous host rocks in contact with felsic intrusives.
Gold-bearing vein deposits can form from hydrothermal solutions.
